intro: Cyrtandra cordifolia, commonly known as the heartleaf cyrtandra, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and mountainous areas. Cyrtandra cordifolia is often found in understory layers of tropical forests, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soil.
